– all drawings are the latest revision

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast materials have been inspected and fit for purpose and free of defects

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast Reinforced Concrete Pipes shall comply with requirements of AS 4058. Pits deeper than 1.00m to be fitted with step irons as shown on the drawings. Step irons are compliant with AS4680 with a minimum average coating thickness equivalent to 600 g/m2.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.619, Cl. 701.04(a), Cl. 701.04(b)(i), Cl. 705.04(d), Cl. 705.11, AS4058, AS4680
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Receival & Inspection Checklist, Manufacturer cetificate or accreditation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Nominated material shall be free from perishable matter and conform with the requirements below:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Nominated material shall be free from perishable matter and conform with the requirements below:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cementituous grouts shall be minimum Type C class dual shinkage compensating, with a minimum 28 day compressive strength of 40 Mpa
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The position of all drainage lines are to be confirmed with the superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Horizontal clearance ( between the walls of trench to the side of pipe shall be 300mm – 600mm for pipes, and 0.5 to 1 times the overall height of the culvert for box culverts. Trench walls to be vertical where practical.
○ > 100mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width < 1500 mm)
○ > 200mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width > 1500 mm)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Compacted to refusal using mechanical plant.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding material shall be compactied to no less than the below thickness:
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipes & pits placed as shown on the drawings. No laying to occur until bedding lines and levels and compaction requirements have been satisfied
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Join pipes with rubber rings in accordance to manufacturer's instructions, check that the rings are clean and undisturbed. Any disturbed rings are to be cleaned and reassembled
2.8 - Place & compact backfill material over pipes
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill under paved area: fill trench with selected back fill material to subgrade level
○ Backfill under area not paved: Back fill trench with selected back fill to a level 0.3 m above the top of pipe or culvert, and ordinary back fill above that level
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No repairs shall be undertaken without the superintendents approval of the repair materials and procedure. All repair procedures undertaken in accordance with Cl 701.25.
3.1 - Compaction and moisture content of backfill & bedding material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill material shall be compactied to a mean density ratio of 92% using standard compactive effort. Bedding material shall be compacted using a compaction plated to refusal.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Materials to be used conform with specification

FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Removal of any existing unsound,obsolete or redundant pavement markings. Removal of any foreign material or debris.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavement markings to set-out in accordance with IFC Drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Line marking installed as per IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Glass beads sprinkled/sprayed on to line marking while in a fluid state to ensure embedment. Glass beads to have uniform distribution

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Completed marking shall be uniform in appearance, texture, width and thickness and the surface shall be free from blister, air bubbles, tears, lumps, streats, overlaps, unbeaded areas, tyre marks or other defects. Edges and cuts-offs shall be neat and sharp, and there shall be no visible run-off, overspray, dribbles,splash or spiliage on to the surrounding area, or on to parked or passing vehicles.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out work in accordance with drawings. The superintendent will review and confirm set out. The alignment and survey/level pegs will be indicated to the Contractor on the Site by the Superintendent prior to the commencement of work. No survey/level pegs to be removed by any persons until completion of works.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: If obstructing waterways, culverts or channels, temporary diversion of discharge of drainage and stormwater to be in place.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All bedding material shall conform with the requirements of sections 812 or 820 for crushed rock and crushed concrete respectively.
○ Unless otherwise stated, 20mm Class 3 or 4 bedding shall be used adn compacted to a thickness of not less than 100mm.
○ Bedding shall be trimmed to appropriate levels, moistened as necessary, and be firmly compacted.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding shall be moist but shall have no free water on the surface.
○ Concrete shall not be placed when the air temperature measured at the point of placement is >35°C or <5°C.
○ Temperature of concrete, measured immediately prior to placing, shall not be less than 10°C or greater than 32°C.
○ Concrete extrusion machines have minimum cement content of 320kg/m3.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Steel reinforcement shall comply with the requirements of AS/NZS 4671, Minimum cover of 50mm

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete is to be fed to extrusion machine at a uniform rate. Concrete is to be satisfactorily compacted so that finished surfaces are free from surface pitting larger than 5mm diameter, honey combing or faulty patches
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Edgings: rendered to a thickness not exceeding 3mm and trowel finished. Concrete to have a neat appearance and uniform colour.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Transverse joints constructed at intervals not exceeding 2.5m.
○ Groove cut 20mm deep and > 5mm wide on exposed surfaces, with vertical cut made through the base of the groove (depth >50mm from surface of section).
○ Prevent bonding between surfacing and edging either paint with bitumen or use a strip of bitumen
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Not earlier than 3 days after casting.

○ Topsoil material free from perishable matter, lumps or balls of clay. Topsoil compacted behind the edging to a level of the top of the edging and to a width not less than 300mm unless otherwise specified.
○ Layers shall not exceed 150mm compacted depth
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
ITP-017 - Sealing Works - Asphalt Laying Works
Prompting Name: ITP-017 - Sealing Works - Asphalt Laying Works

Name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure this mix design has been registered and is approved by Superintendent prior to laying mix.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Correspondence of receipt of mix design
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: VR approval, Completed ITP
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Surface on which asphalt is to be placed is essentially dry and free from puddles and defects (holes, cracks, unstable material and edge irregularities) and loose materials.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The majority of the surface area to be paved has a temperature greater than or equal to the following:
○ Base & Intermediate Courses: 5°C for conventional binders or 10°C for PMBs & Class 600
○ Wearing Courses: 10°C for conventional binders or 15°C for PMBs
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Runs to be marked to ensure placement of joints satisfy the following unless otherwise approved by the Client:
○ Transverse Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least 2m
○ Longitudinal Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least
○ 150mm and be within 300mm of the lane line or centre of lane. Wearing course shall be on lane lines.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Measure and mark out runs by tape measure or survey

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The placement of asphalt on the sub-base or granular base for a new pavement or for an overlay of an existing bituminous surfaced pavement shall not commence until the consent to proceed is obtained from the Client.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Asphalt is not segregated, binder is not separated or does not contain uncoated particles and the temperature from mixing plant is not more than 175°C.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ability to locate asphalt test results placed in three dimensions i.e. start/end chainage, offset/lane and layer
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Fulton Hogan Quality Plan
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Daily Lot Record
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Thickness of asphalt layer conforms to asphalt thickness on drawings or specifications
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Dips using ruler or dip stick
FREQUENCY: During paving and after final roll
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The finished surface of asphalt wearing course shall be of uniform appearance, free of dragged areas, cracks, open textured patches and roller marks
FREQUENCY: During paving and after final roll
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The edge of the wearing course shall be either flush with or not more than 5 mm above the lip of the channel unless otherwise specified
2.7 - Alignment of layers not placed against concrete edge
FREQUENCY: During paving and at completion of work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The edge of asphalt layers shall not be more than 50mm inside nor more than 100mm outside, the designed offset from centreline or design line.
○ The rate of change of offset of the edge of layer shall not be greater than 25mm in 10m
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: For layers <50mm, if characteristic density ratio is:
○ 91.0% to 93.9% Lot may be accepted at reduced rate
For layers ≥50mm, if characteristic thickness is:
○ 91.0% to 95.9% Lot may be accepted at reduced rate
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Individual departures from design not to exceed ±5mm with a standard deviation of no greater than 8mm

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All crused rock used in the works shall be Class 2, 20mm nominal size.
○ Sand shall conform with the requirements of AS2758 - 1998 and AS1141 - 1997 and shall have grading within the limits as defined in the code.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The line, level and location of all pits & structures must be in accordance with the provided design drawings.
○ The position of all pits are to be confirmed with the superintendent if ambiguity arises from the drawings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Survey Report. This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bottom of trench shall be compacted and at a depth greater than 75mm below the specified level of the invert of the pipe to allow for appropriate bedding.
○ Any trench which may have been excavated to a greater depth than necessary shall be filled into the required level with concrete 1:3:6 mix. Any loose material shall be removed.
○ Trench shall be battered, benched or shored in line with WorkSafe code of practice when required by assessment under 1.5m in depth and is mandatory over 1.5m.
○ No stockpiles within 2m of end of the trench to reduce bearing pressure.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Appx 2: Cl 8.0, Cl 9.0, Cl 11.0
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Base of the trench shall be inspected prior to placement of bedding.

○ Reinforcement shall be check for correct cover & lap as per drawings

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All pits are to be constructed in accordance with IDM Spec 415. Pit should also be constructed in accordance with site specific drawings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Horizontal clearance ( between the walls of trench to the side of pipe shall be 300mm – 600mm for pipes, and 0.5 to 1 times the overall height of the culvert for box culverts. Trench walls to be vertical where practical.
○ > 100mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width < 1500 mm)
○ > 200mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width > 1500 mm)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Provide mass Concrete support around branch pipe minimum 150mm thick. Concrete shall be grade S40 with a maximum water cement ratio of 0.50.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforment in main drain to be cut and formed into collar. Care should be taken to prevent damage to pipe and to enshore opening is kept to a minimum.
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer / Site Foreman, Superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where connection cannot be rendered from inside main drain, connection to consists of 300mm long stub to allow rendering from outside. Bonding of new to old concrete shall be sufficent to ensure no cracks or leaks form. Concrete surfaces to be scabbled, cleaned primed with parchem nitobond SBR. All reinforcement without adequite cover to be sealed with epoxy or similar.
2.7 - Place & compact backfill material over pipes

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ordinary earth from excavation which contains no rock fragments compacted in layers no greater than 150mm. Compaction to be minimum 92% modified A.A.S.H.O. using handheld mechanical equipment. Top 100mm to be topsoil and seeded
3.1 - Compaction and moisture content of backfill & bedding material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill material shall be compactied to a mean density ratio of 92% using standard compactive effort. Bedding material shall be compacted using a compaction plated to refusal.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Omnigrip CST must not be applied to wet pavements under any circumstances and suspension of application should be considered:
– During periods of dew, drizzle or rain
– If the surface temperature drops below 10°C and is in decline.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Omnigrip Technical Data Sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
RESPONSIBILITY: Fulton Hogan Engineer / YT Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that the substrate is dry and clean of all contaminates. Asphalt pavements shall be virgourously brushed or treated with compressed air to remove dust and loose aggregate.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Omnigrip Technical Data Sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Epoxy Part A should be added to Epoxy Part B at a ratio of 1:1 and mixed using a slow speed for 90 to 120 seconds to obtain a homegenous mix. Add pigment colouring throughout the mixing process.
○ Once mixed the resin should be immediately applied & spread evenly using a serrated squeegee or notched trowel at an average rate of 1.35 - 1.7 kg/m2.
○ The resion should self-level, however, the use of a 20mm find nap roller should be used to back roll and level the resin.
○ The applied resin should receive the aggregate dressing within 10-15 minutes of application ensuring no wet resin is left exposed.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Omnigrip Technical Data Sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: For any surface works on asphalt there must be a minimum curing period of 7-10 days.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Omnigrip Technical Data Sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Approved durham ductile heelguard trench grate and frame product NO. CHP30C or approved

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out work in accordance with drawings. The superintendent will review and confirm set out. The alignment and survey/level pegs will be indicated to the Contractor on the Site by the Superintendent prior to the commencement of work. No survey/level pegs to be removed by any persons until completion of works.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: If obstructing waterways, culverts or channels, temporary diversion of discharge of drainage and stormwater to be in place.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All bedding material shall conform with the requirements of sections 812 or 820 for crushed rock and crushed concrete respectively.
○ Unless otherwise stated, 20mm Class 3 or 4 bedding shall be used adn compacted to a thickness of not less than 100mm.

○ Bedding shall be trimmed to appropriate levels, moistened as necessary, and be firmly compacted. A Slurry of low to medium slump concrete should be poured on the base of the excavated trench prior to placing the PVC in position. The Height of the slurry bed should be determined based on figure c in the intallation guildlines

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Place each section of PVC in position under the string line. Align each end of the connecting PVC/frame sections so that they are touching. use clamp or bolts to hold the PVC/frame sections together

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pour Concrete to approximately half the depth of the excavated trench. The concrete should now be compacted to remove air pockets and ensure that the grooves of the. PVC trench are sufficiently filled.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The final concrete pour should be completed to finish height, with the finish surface being graded towards the trench, as required.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Transition from trench grate to existing curb in a neat transition
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Transverse joints constructed at intervals not exceeding 2.5m.
○ Groove cut 20mm deep and > 5mm wide on exposed surfaces, with vertical cut made through the base of the groove (depth >50mm from surface of section).
○ Prevent bonding between surfacing and edging either paint with bitumen or use a strip of bitumen
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Not earlier than 3 days after casting.

○ Topsoil material free from perishable matter, lumps or balls of clay. Topsoil compacted behind the edging to a level of the top of the edging and to a width not less than 300mm unless otherwise specified.
○ Layers shall not exceed 150mm compacted depth
